(5/5) The Group has also made big strides in providing unprecedented support and guidance to help British and American SMEs trade in each other’s markets through the UK-US SME Dialogue.

(4/5) The UK-US Working Group has already secured continuity for £12.8 billion of trade covered by our Mutual Recognition Agreements. This will allow businesses to keep trading as they do today without any extra red tape.
(3/5) This Working Group has held important discussions in areas such as sustainability, services, agriculture, financial services, government procurement, intellectual property and SMEs.

(2/5) Our teams will continue to work together in the lead up to formal negotiations. This will help to strengthen our trade and investment relationship with the US and seize a golden opportunity for the UK and one of our closest allies.

(1/5) The 6th UK-US Trade and Investment Working Group concluded in London today. This means we have now held exploratory discussions on all the major policy areas. Our team will be ready to swiftly open trade negotiations after Brexit.

(4/5) The UK-US Working Group has already secured continuity for £12.8 billion of trade covered by our Mutual Recognition Agreements. This will allow businesses to keep trading as they do today without any extra red tape.
(3/5) This Working Group has held important discussions in areas such as sustainability, services, agriculture, financial services, government procurement, intellectual property and SMEs.

(2/5) Our teams will continue to work together in the lead up to formal negotiations. This will help to strengthen our trade and investment relationship with the US and seize a golden opportunity for the UK and one of our closest allies.

(1/5) The 6th UK-US Trade and Investment Working Group concluded in London today. This means we have now held exploratory discussions on all the major policy areas. Our team will be ready to swiftly open trade negotiations after Brexit.

Enthusiastic introduction from ⁦@LiamFox⁩ at ⁦@Policy_Exchange⁩ for the ⁦@Jeremy_Hunt⁩ speech on No Deal preparations. #HastobeHunt https://t.co/z9Xc2fv3ME

10. (2) If my judgement is that there is no deal to be done I will immediately cease all discussions with the European Union and focus the whole country’s attention on no deal preparations. #HastobeHunt
9. I will provide the necessary finance to support the development of customs solutions which can help deliver our cast iron guarantee that we will never put up a hard border. #HastobeHunt

8. We will pursue the government’s existing approach to tariffs, balancing the benefits of liberalisation for consumers with appropriate exceptions to safeguard vulnerable industries and protect the prosperity and wellbeing of communities across every part of the UK. #HastobeHunt

7. HMT will also produce a ‘No Deal Relief Programme’. This includes a £6bn fund for the fishing and farming sectors who export to Europe to ease transition out of the European Union whilst honouring our international obligations. #HastobeHunt

6. The Treasury will start preparations on a No Deal Brexit Budget to be delivered in the 1st week parliament is back in Sept. This will include cutting corporation tax cut to 12.5%, increasing the annual allowance to £5m, and taking 90% of high street businesses out of rates.
5. I will also establish a National Logistics Committee led by the Department for Transport to produce a plan to keep goods flowing in and out of the UK in the event of No Deal. #HastobeHunt
4. In order to avoid a ‘take it or leave it’ approach I and the Brexit Secretary will engage with European leaders and the European Commission during July and August. #HastobeHunt

3. A new political negotiating team with members of the ERG, DUP, One Nation Group & Welsh & Scottish Conservatives, led by the Brexit Secretary and supported at an official level by Crawford Falconer. He will be supported by top experts from around the world. #HastobeHunt

2. A ‘No Deal’ Cabinet Task Force: to follow up any areas where government preparations are insufficient, to agree & publish financial support for industries affected by tariff changes & to approve infrastructure changes that may not be completed by 31st Oct #HastobeHunt

1.On day one of my Premiership I would order an immediate ramping up of No Deal preparations. All government departments will be expected to act on the basis that we are leaving without a deal on October 31st #HastobeHunt
Today I am setting out my 10 point plan. #HastobeHunt

71% of people said the UK should remain a member of the @WTO, compared to just 7% who said we should leave. Support for WTO ranks only behind the United Nations (76%) and Commonwealth (73%).

Support for ‘free trade’ ranked behind only ‘interests and welfare of its own people’ and ‘leader on global political issues such as human rights’. Our trade policy will deliver benefits for British people and include important safeguards on human rights.
@TheBFPG In a separate question, 35% of people said free trade is one of the 3 most important issues the UK should be representing on the world stage.

Extremely encouraging polling released today by @TheBFPG finds that international trade is the UK’s top policy priority. 44% of people said that the UK should be spending most money on trade – more than any other aspect of foreign policy.

🔝 The UK remains the top destination in Europe, & 3rd highest in the 🌎 for foreign direct investment.

(5/6) As we move forward with delivering Brexit we must unite our party and our country around a wider agenda, address the division in our society and provide sensible, responsible government.

(4/6) As such, deal-making is part of his DNA - and that is the great challenge before us. We must send a strong message to the EU that we want a deal — but crucially, make clear that we are also willing to walk away without one. @Jeremy_Hunt gets that.
(3/6) Jeremy is a successful entrepreneur and instinctively understands the needs of the businesses we all rely on to deliver prosperity.

(2/6) Throughout his career, Jeremy has a track record of achievement and he has impressed me during his time in Cabinet as Culture Secretary, Health Secretary and as an outstanding Foreign Secretary.

.@LiamFox  🗣️: 'UK exports continue to grow and beat records across Europe, these new numbers published today highlight the quality and innovation of British goods and services and how much they are valued across the globe'

⭐️ NEW STATS ⭐️

🤝 British exports hit a record high 🤝

🚢 British exports now stand at a record high of £640bn
📈 That’s a year-on-year increase of 3.0%
👠 Goods exports increased by 4.2% to £356.1bn
🌐 Services exports increased by 1.4% to £283.8bn

Separate data published by the OECD showed between 2016 and 2018:

📈 UK total exports grew at 13.8%
🇩🇪 Faster than Germany at 10.5%
🇫🇷 Faster than France at 10.1%
🇮🇹 And faster than Italy  at 11.4%.

A number of other agreements are at an advanced stage and we will be signing more in the coming weeks. Follow @TradeGovUK for the latest.

But it’s only responsible for us to prepare for all outcomes and that’s what government has been doing.
 
In event of no-deal, we have already secured agreements with countries that account for over a quarter of UK trade covered by EU trade agreements. https://t.co/Y7Gkd5W0YP

However, there is only one way to guarantee we avoid disruption to trade after Brexit and that is by getting a deal with the EU.
 
This will secure our trade with the EU and with all of those countries covered by our existing agreements.
 
Deal explainer: https://t.co/5yMc3HqvUs

For perspective, we have already signed some of the largest of these agreements including Switzerland which alone accounts for around 20% of trade with these countries.
 
The countries covered by the 20 smallest agreements count for just 0.8% of our total trade. https://t.co/GWfsmUJOKT

But we do want to avoid any disruption to our trade with the EU and those countries we already have trade agreements with.

Nearly 40% of our current trade is not covered by existing EU agreements. https://t.co/pUCNhesOID

Liam Fox: "A customs union a betrayal of Brexit"

International trade secretary says options being supported by Labour, SNP and others in tonight's votes are not "a proper #Brexit" 

https://t.co/5mAdiYmVE4 https://t.co/GsHNseb8No

(3/4)To join a #CustomsUnion with the EU, like Turkey has done, would leave us trapped – unable to conclude proper trade agreements with countries around the world. #Brexit #FreeTrade #FreeTradeUK https://t.co/BW21C8UQY5

(2/4) The UK cannot have an independent trade policy if we stay in the Customs Union. In the #CustomsUnion we would have to apply European trade law without having a say in how it is made. #Brexit #FreeTrade #FreeTradeUK https://t.co/trbFFKlCR2

(1/4) Last year, I set out my view on staying in the #CustomsUnion with the EU. It would put us in a worse position than we are in today – a complete sell-out of Britain’s national interest and a betrayal of the voters in the referendum. My view hasn’t changed. #Brexit #FreeTrade https://t.co/hzTyEGC2Hh

@The_TUC (3/4) We will maintain standards in all the EU trade deals when they are transitioned.
@The_TUC (2/4) As for worker's rights and standards? I have said time and time again – we will not undermine worker’s rights or product/environmental standards in any future trade agreement.

@The_TUC (1/4) The best way to achieve trade continuity is to pass the Withdrawal Agreement. To say you don't support the deal and then criticise a lack of access to these agreements is total hypocrisy.

Liam Fox promised to have 40 trade deals ready by March 2019.

So far he's managed 7.

Leaving the EU customs union puts the UK in a weak position in trade negotiations.

One of many reasons why Mrs May's Brexit deal will be a disaster for UK workers.

https://t.co/xHRFOELorH
